triageFlags.title: Excessive Debt-to-Income Ratio
triageFlags.description: The applicant's DTI ratio exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to affordability concerns.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, Tier C applicants must have a DTI ratio of 35% or less. The applicant's DTI ratio of 55% indicates a significant affordability issue.

triageFlags.title: Excessive Loan-to-Value Ratio
triageFlags.description: The LTV ratio is significantly above the maximum allowable limit for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to excessive LTV ratio.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 95% for Tier C applicants. The current LTV of 224.44% is far beyond this limit, indicating a high risk of financial loss.

content.reasoning: The applicant's DTI ratio of 55% exceeds the maximum allowable 35% for their credit tier (C), and the LTV ratio of 224.44% is significantly above the maximum permitted 95%. These factors indicate a high risk of default and non-compliance with underwriting policies.
